comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1. "Download" from eclipse.org
2. "download now" for Linux x86_64 (112Mb)
3. untar
4. ./eclipse

Get splash screen (too quickly to read) frollowed by dialog:
"An error has occurred. See the log file
/home/marcus/workspace/.metadata/.log."

The contents of this file is included.

yours, Marcus

Setting version field to 3.2.2.

Though the error looks a bit different, can you follow up here whether https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=174547#c8 helps you or not.  And if not, have any other 64-bit eclipse releases worked for you on this same machine?

Hi.

This is a fresh install, so I have had no history of a working Eclipse on this box. Sorry.

I'll try disabling mozilla support and then the drop in jar. hang tight why I try this.

yours, Marcus

Hi.

This line...
MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME="" ./eclipse
...had no effect.

Dropping the jar file org.eclipse.swt.gtk.linux.x86_64_3.2.2.v3236a.jar into eclipse/plugins also had no effect. It did not overwrite any existing file when it was dropped in.

yours, Marcus

Sorry for the late follow-up.  Can you try:

- cd /home/marcus/download/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/40/1/.cp/
- ldd libswt-pi-gtk-3236.so
- check the output, see if any dependencies are not being resolved on your machine

Also, you may wish to try a 3.3 stream build such as 3.3M6.

Hi.

Just done a rebuild with a 32 bit Java 5. Sorry, but I had to get on with some work, so I cannot pursue this further.

yours, Marcus
Closing report, please reopen if running the gtk-64 eclipse 3.3 release fails for you.
